thanks @apaszke. great points :) I was actually also wondering about following:

  1. in what cases do users use torch.autograd.grad? do they use it with models and what is the usage like there? people only pass the inputs but get the grads for weights as well?

  2. for torch.autograd.backward, we haven't see much slowness practically for various models that we have tested. In some cases, better data packing has resulted in the better speed. :)

  3. I agree that passing the list of variables by asking users might make the ugly and prone to mistakes.

also cc @ezyang , what are your thoughts? :)

body:
thanks @apaszke. great points :) I was actually also wondering about following: 

1. in what cases do users use `torch.autograd.grad`? do they use it with models and what is the usage like there? people only pass the inputs but get the grads for weights as well?

2. for `torch.autograd.backward`, we haven't see much slowness practically for various models that we have tested. In some cases, better data packing has resulted in the better speed. :)

3. I agree that passing the list of variables by asking users might make the ugly and prone to mistakes. 

also cc @ezyang , what are your thoughts? :)
